text:
Hi. Not sure is it a right address to ask a question on HS form submission outside the HS pages.
I have non-HS landing page which has HS form.
The goal is to put sumission into active lists which will be imported to marketing event.
It wouldn't be the problem to solve only one event. Bu I have it 60. So, I'm looking for solution. Whatever I get on idea, I can't reach website URL property, so I can put it as a criteria for the list.

Did anybody have this kind of challenge?
It looks like the file was already created. Have you tried creating the file in a different folder to check if it is a permission issue?

If I understand, you want to have automation happen after the form is submitted, right? And the same form is used on 60 different pages or 60 forms?

If it is one form on 60 pages, you can do this by using a trigger that is a form submit.

If it is 60 forms, you can create a hidden property, that when populated is the trigger for the automation.
Form submission event

Contact property trigger

Could be a UTM or parameter:
Or you could set it to a specific property that is a hidden field in your form. You could use Is Known or a specific value depending upon your property.

Hi Jon, thanks for reply. It's one form for 60 different pages.
In form submission I can see the name of conversion page (and in contact objects the URL is under Latest Drill Down 1 property), but none of them I can't use as a criteria in active list.

I haven't try with hidden fields.
What is UTM?

Are you trying to create a list of all form submissions?

Or, are you trying to create automation after someone has filled out the form?
You could make a list of everyone that submitted that one form, and then add a column to the list.

Hi
How to setup private app for calling? on Hubsport
Want to load iframe when contact call button clicked.. The call control and post call activity will happen there.

I want to group submissions from particular page to an active list. When I have this lists I will attach them to a marketing event. I have starter subscription, so I can only work with simple step workflows.
The goal is to have for each landing page a separated and unique active list. So this are 60 active lists
In your list, can you create this :
Change the name of the form to your form name
You can then add a Page View to further filter it:
Or you can use the UTM parameters. UTMs are query string parameters that you pass on the URL address.
Thank you very much. I will feed you back a sunes i test it.

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Hi everyone,
I'm trying to send data from HubSpot to Azure. Does anyone have the documentation on how to prepare my database or how to find the correct property names for making the connection?
Thanks!

Hey all! 
Does anyone know if there's a way to make a Quote URL password protected? 
I know there isn't a way in-app but wondering if there's a solution I might not be thinking of you put in the code on the template or something. Thank you!
Jon, thank you very much for help. For whatever reason I can't find *Page View* criteria under *+Add Filter*. Amazing
Even ChatSpot told me this action steps, and I can't find it.
Of course it's only for Marketing Pro and up.

Can you use First Page or Last Page under the Contact properties?

It is not ideal, but maybe that would be a workaround?
Or use the idea of the hidden fields

Hello - I am inquiring about the capabilities of using a “sandbox” within HubSpot.  We have a production system up and running - Marketing, CRM, and CMS.

Now, what I would like to do if possible is to sync/copy our production CMS down to a sandbox.  The reason for this is that there is some significant  work that needs to be done and I would like to avoid causing and issues in our production env.

So is this possible and if so, how would one go about doing this or if you can point me in the right direction.

Note that once we are done with the work and prove out that everything is good ( if possible we want to be able to show an end to end navigation solution between the sand box and the staging version of our eCommerce platform ( which is not hosted on HubSpot)

Is it then possible to push the approved changes from the sandbox up to production to make them live
is HubSpot having issues? all custom app CRM cards are not rendering in all of our portals

not the case for us
ah, i see the edit

Looks like it's fixed now :orange_heart:

Hey <@U05UV02FUP7>, if you're reffering to the enterprise "Sandbox" function - from my experience - it's not really ment for CMS work. For CMS sandboxing I'd use content staging and a seperate/standalone CMS sandbox.
If you're using <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging|content staging> - everything is in your live portal and won't interfere with the live pages unless you push them from staging to live. Then the pages from staging will be replacing the live ones.
With a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/get-started|CMS sandbox>* it's a bit different. Those sandboxes are great for theme module development, especially if you're using <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/cms/quickstart|local development>. If you should build pages in the sandbox you could move them via the pages API - but - I recommend to use content staging. Saves you a lot of time and potential headaches :slightly_smiling_face: Another possible solution might be to create a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/cms/setup/github-integration#use-the-HubSpot-cms-deploy-github-action-(recommended)|GitHub action>. So you're pushing changes from local to a git repo, this repo pushes it to your dev account and your live account.

In terms of showing the navigation on an external service - you will most likely run into CORS issues displaying something on a different domain so my recommendation would be to recreate the navigation from HubSpot in your external eCom platform.


*the CMS Developer Sandbox accounts might be limited. I'm recommending to create an App Developer account on the page, which let's you create up to 10 "almost" Enterprise level portals(there are a few limitiations for good reason but not in terms of most common functionalities)
